intro: Knautia sylvatica var. legionensis, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and somewhat woody at the base. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
